title: Business Trip
description: David Wallace sends Michael on a business trip to Winnipeg to help him forget about Holly's transfer to Nashua, and Pam tells Jim that she failed a class and has to stay in New York City.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you know that in Morocco it is common to exchange a small gift when meeting somebody for the first time?  In Japan you must always commit suicide to avoid embarrassment.  In Italy you must always wash your hands after going to the bathroom.  This is considered to be polite.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why are you telling us this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am jetting off on an international business trip.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where are you going?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To Can-A-da.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Canada.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My boss is sending me abroad to do a presentation to an international client and I have always been intrigued by all things international.  The women, the pancakes, the man of mystery...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Meredith, I would like you to pretend that you are from Abu Dhabi.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [British accent] Hello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am ashamed at your naked face. I must cover it with my jacket. [covers Meredith's face with his jacket] You are now sexy in your culture.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: T minus...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Six point five days. [winces as Kevin smacks him on the back]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [walks up behind Jim and puts his hands on his shoulders] One more week.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam comes back from New York next week and everyone here has just been so excited for me. And involved. And intrusive. And weird.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: On more week. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Heh heh. [Jim gives camera an odd look]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on speakerphone] Do you have your passport?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have my passport. [pats jacket pocket]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Got your per diem?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have my per diem. [holds up money] I already know what I am going to spend this on.  I am going to buy a sweater.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael, the... that's for your food.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well I'll just... I'll use different money for that.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I was happy to send Michael on this trip.  He's been feeling pretty down since we had to transfer Holly up to New Hampshire.  But this little perk really seemed to turn him around. [chuckling] And it's pretty tough to find somebody who wants to go up to Winnipeg mid-November.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And business class air, like a five-star hotel in the sky, nothing but the best.  Actually better than a five-star hotel 'cause you get a big, cushy seat and you sit in a row of people and to eat, whatever the mind can imagine.  I think I am going to have a filet with mushroom sauce.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Well, I'm just glad to know you're happy because you know I felt bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well that is all in the past.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: And in terms of nightlife, when you get there just ask the concierge.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They have one of those?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in a singsong voice] Lets do this!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, why do you need three suitcases?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Two are for souvenirs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you have your money belt?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do. It's right here. [indicates to waist]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no.  You want to wear that puppy right up on the breastbone like a bra. [demonstrates]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I don't want to wear a bra.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here, let me help you. [reaches for Michael's money belt]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop it! Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you want to get robbed in a foreign country? I wash my hands of this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  Where is my translator?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Monsieur.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There he is.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm just bidding a bon voyage a La Mon Petit fiancee. Translation:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on airplane] Welcome to Cribs-the business class edition. Check this out. Mimosa.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ah... sweet!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Handed to me as I sat down.  This was my hot towel.  It is still wet.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Michael Gary Scott rolling like a pimp!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Take a sip of that. [hands Andy his mimosa]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mmmhmmm...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That good?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mmmm...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't drink all of it.  Give some to Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's really good. [offers mimosa to Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You want one of your own? I can hook you up.

quotes.speaker: Stewardess
quotes.text: I'm sorry.  You'll need to keep moving.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, this is Beth.  This is my personal valet/flight attendant and she will be helping me this morning.

quotes.speaker: Beth
quotes.text: We need to keep the isle clear.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get back, get back.  Come on, get back to the slums.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh boy. [follows Oscar back to coach]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whisper] Hey... guys, check it out.  My own personal DVD player and 20 movies.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [whispers] Andy brought one too.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [loudly] Harry and the Henderson's

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shhhh! Keep it down.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I made egg salad sandwiches. Do you want one? [holds up sandwich]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Could you have picked something stinkier to bring on a plane? [Andy laughs] My God, Oscar. Really? Do you have a bag of baby poop in there too, to share with everybody? No, I will be ordering my own food, thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to stewardess] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Beth
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um. I'd like to see a menu please.

quotes.speaker: Beth
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry. There are no meals on flights less than two hours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh... okay. [looks back at Andy and Oscar] Doesn't matter, because I am going to take a nap.  I think I am going to use my complimentary blindfold.  I will don it... and oh! Look at that.  I can't see because I am in a- [cart crashes into Michael's leg] GAH!

quotes.speaker: Beth
quotes.text: What would you like to drink?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [walks into Kelly's cubicle and sets a box down on the desk] Just checking out where I'm going to be pretty soon.  When Pam gets back.  Gonna be close quarters.  Gonna be a lot of tension.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: For you.  I'm with Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This looks like where I'll probably do my pushups every day. [gets on floor and starts doing pushups]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Is that supposed to impress me? [Ryan starts trying to do one-armed pushups]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [talking head] No. Not going to happen.  He has hurt me too much and too often.  And I am in a healthy relationship so I'm not gonna flaunt it and I'm not gonna hurt him, but that door is closed.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [making out with Ryan on her desk] What are we doing?  This is so wrong.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah... Mmmmm...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [going up escalator in the hotel] This is nice.  This is nice.  Move in here.  Very sweet... ah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'll check us in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Very cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very cool.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We are going to find out where the action is, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Where's the concierge?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes! Wallace said there would be one of those.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mmm... bingo! [indicates towards concierge desk] Follow moi, bro-sieur.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to concierge] What about a nice sushi place?  Maybe a place with a view?

quotes.speaker: Concierge Marie
quotes.text: Tsk... Oh.  Matsuki.  That's a good one.  Uh, you may walk there if you wish or you man take the number seventeen bus until 9:00.  Other than that you can take the taxi and the number is right there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow! Wow, I am blown away by this. I, um... I-ah! This is great, thank you!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: One final question. Where might you find yourself on a Winnipeg night like tonight?

quotes.speaker: Concierge Marie
quotes.text: Oh, the Huntsman is good.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [nodding towards Michael] The Huntsman.

quotes.speaker: Concierge Marie
quotes.text: Down here... the financial district.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A concierge is like the Winnipeg equivalent of a geisha.  This is a woman who has been trained in the fine art of fanciness and pleasure.  And when you meet one, it is intoxicating.  Just what the doctor ordered.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [at school in NYC] Can't believe this. [pulls out cell phone... sighs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [in office] Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [over the phone] I just talked to my advisor. Failing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. I thought you were good at Flash.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I was, and then they switched to Acrobat just as I was learning Quark.  I hate computers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, okay, it's no big deal.  So you're not a computer geek.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have to stay and retake it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [looks shocked] W--Wow. Um. Well... okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That means another twelve weeks.  [pause] Can you do this for another three months?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's not-- It's not about me.  I mean, this your dream.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [over phone] I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And you went to New York to do this.  So when you come back you come back the right way. Right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [starting to cry] Right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [concerned look on face] You okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [over phone] Yeah I'm fine.  Um... my cell phone battery's low, so I have to let you go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [over phone] Love you. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Love you too. [hangs up phone, Pam sits on a bench crying]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guys, she's in there.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Engaging wings [imitates mechanical sound]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm probably going to leave after one drink.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's do this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah with a hot slab of Canadian bacon in your hand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [goes up to concierge from the hotel] Excuse me, hello. Concierge Marie. Michael Scott.  Good to see you again.

quotes.speaker: Concierge Marie
quotes.text: Good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, this is my associate uh, from Dunder Mifflin, uh, Oscar Martinez.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Nice to meet you. [shakes Marie's hand]

quotes.speaker: Concierge Marie
quotes.text: Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Works in accounting.  This is uh, concierge Marie...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...who works at our hotel.  You look, how do you say, radiant tonight.

quotes.speaker: Concierge Marie
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And it is, how do you say, a beautiful night--

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She's foreign.  I am-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: For Madame et monsieur. [hands Michael and Marie a glass of wine]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Concierge Marie
quotes.text: Thank you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let me get a picture of you guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everyone is going to end up dying someday.  And I think it's better to die with people you like... like Oscar, and Andy, and concierge Marie... than to know that there's somebody out there that you love that you're not with.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright, I've scoped out the joint.  Those two dudes are as good as naked.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How do you even know they're gay?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Come on! It's Dandy Dale and Foppy McGee over there. [turns to bartender] Mademoiselle! Beer me dos Long Island iced teas s'ill vous plait. [to Oscar] Bad decision in a glass.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't care if you're gay, straight, engaged... whatever. A guy needs intercourse.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You'll thank me when they spank thee.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Don't do this. [watches Andy take drinks to the other table]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do you guys like apples?

quotes.speaker: Guy at Table
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do you like apples?

quotes.speaker: Guy at Table
quotes.text: Uh, sorry... what?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, how do you like these apples? [sets drinks on table] Alright, on a scale of 1 - 10, how hot is that dude? [indicates towards Oscar who waves slightly]

quotes.speaker: Guy at Table
quotes.text: Is he your boyfriend or something?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, but he could be yours if you play your cards right.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: Dude, leave us alone alright?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gentleman. [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dude, you struck out.  They're totally stuck up.  Here... drink up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How about this one? It's Christmas eve--

quotes.speaker: Concierge Marie
quotes.text: Mmm-hmmm...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: --and everything's closed and you need to get some dry cleaning done. 12:00 midnight. Where do you go? What do you do?  What do you do? Come on! What do you do?

quotes.speaker: Concierge Marie
quotes.text: Uh...A stro cleaners on St. Johns place is the only place open on that day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Unbelievable! Unbelievable.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: If you don't mind me asking--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Anything.  You can ask me anything.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm your wingman.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Its just that I've sat next to Angela for a very long, very long time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right-o.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How could anyone stand that woman?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What do you see in her?  Wh -- what do you see in Angela?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What do I see in Angela?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I want to know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I see through a hard exterior to a little jelly in the middle.  She is teaching me to be a better person. And she's working really hard on that.  And she has the softest skin I've ever seen and I can't wait to have sex with her.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You haven't had sex?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Y-Are you guys waiting to get married, or?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Honestly, I don't know what we're waiting for.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Andy, something is wrong with that woman.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What is wrong with her?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'd like to know.  You should call her and ask her. I'd like to know what's wrong with her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I should call her and ask her. What is wrong with her?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Do it! It's a-- Call her! [Andy holds up phone]  Oh my God, don't call her! Don't call her, Andy. [giggling] Andy, don't call her!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Too late, too late. It's dialing... now it's ringing. [Oscar laughs] Shh...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [on phone] Hello? Hello?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What is wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why won't you do Andy?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That was Oscar and he wants to know why you won't do me and I think it's a valid question.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Are you drunk?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is Andy Bernard!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I know who this is!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I wanna take you to sex school.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [over phone] Who is that monkey?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is somebody there?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Are you drunk?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I have needs.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We will discuss this later.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Naked.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We'll discuss it later naked.  I want to see you naked.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [standing outside hotel room... whispering] Do you want to get some breakfast or something?

quotes.speaker: Concierge Marie
quotes.text: I am so tired.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [noticing that everyone is giving him a sympathetic look] How does everyone know already?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Know what?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Pam failed art school.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, well, doesn't surprise me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Have you seen her painting, Jim? The building? There are shadows coming from two different directions.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Dwight, stop it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? Are there two suns?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Last I checked, that's not an office building in the Andromeda galaxy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm gonna grab a cup of coffee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's totally unrealistic.  There are no lines in the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oscar

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That was fun last night.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, it was.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know, it's true what they say-- Long Island iced teas are way stronger in Canada.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, um... thanks for trying to hook me up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You kidding me? It's what I do. Get the whole nine 'nards. [Oscar laughs]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I can't believe we called her up. [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Totally. [continues laughing] What-- Who?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm talking about Angela. I can't believe we called her up last night.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We called Angela?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You-- you call-- you called her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That was real?! I thought I dreamed that.  Oh, God!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, God!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So bad!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Good morning, Michael.  [Michael approaches table] Are you ready for the meeting?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Slept like a baby.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Mmmm.... mmm. This can't happen again.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This has to happen again. Darryl can't happen again. Look at me. Do you want me to do more push-ups?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay. You have to break up with Darryl.  I already typed out a text message for you.  All you have to do is press "send".

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't know.  I mean, it's well-written and all, I just--

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Has to be done. We'll press send together. [phone beeps]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God.  He's going to kill us.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'd like to see him try. [kisses Kelly... cell phone beeps]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh! He says it's cool. [laughs] He said, "It's cool".

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's all he wrote?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That's all he wrote.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Can I see it?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Mmm hmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Didn't you two date for like a long time?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Mmm hmm. It's like a fairy tale! [grabs Ryan and kisses him] Mmmm...

quotes.speaker: Client
quotes.text: I'll be honest with you-- we've been talking with Catalyst Paper. Their prices are better than yours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, people continue to come back to us time and time again because they feel cared for here.  They feel respected and they feel that their needs matter.  They are treated like human beings. [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Client
quotes.text: Everything okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh man, she is so pissed. [sitting down by Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Mmm...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She's taking us back to first base.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What is first base with Angela?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I get to kiss her forehead. [looks at Oscar] I had a good time hanging out this weekend.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I had a good time too.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wingman for life. W.M.F.L

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You up for a chest bump?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Bro hug? [Oscar shakes head... then sticks his hand out and Andy shakes it] Back to basics. I like it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I had to go all the way to Canada to get to know a guy who sits 20 feet away from me.  And he's delightful! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey! I just heard you guys made the sale.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, we locked him up for two years.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Good, very good.  See, told you.  Sounds like somebody had a good trip.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Actually the trip sucked.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The trip sucked, David. It blew chunks. It was terrible. It was a bad trip.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did not like the trip. Well, starting with her airport shuttle which was basically just a van.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And business class which was basically just coach. And the hotel which sucked big time.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: The hotel? What, M-- okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was not, it sucked.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I'm sorry to hear the hotel was bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh and thanks for the tip on the concerige.  That was great.  That was great.  That was-- that was a--

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay, okay. Hey, hey, hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was a really good choice.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael, please lets listen for a second.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, David. You listen to me.  Why did you send her away? That-- God.  You knew I liked her and you just sent her away.  And that-- that was a sucky thing to do man.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael, sometimes--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was a really sucky thing to do.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Sometimes, we- [Michael hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why have I stayed at Dunder Mifflin for so long? Certainly not because of the paycheck.  'Cause I could be making more money as a doctor or a professional athlete.  I think it's because they respect me.  A boss that will not fire you, even though you just tell him off... right to his face... over the hone.  That's respect.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You did it, man. [fist bumps Jim] Day one. Congrats.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks man.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm coming back the wrong way.  [smiles at Jim across the parking lot] It's not because of you.  I don't like graphic design. That's it. [laughs] Stop smiling. I really didn't like it.  It's just designing logos and stuff.... and I miss Scranton.  But it is not because I missed you. I just really wanted to come home... and I know you said to come home the right way, but you can't tell me what to do. Got it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I missed you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I missed you too. [Jim kisses her]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. I need you to make five copies of these. [hands Pam papers]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not going inside.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alright. First thing in the morning then.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Welcome back.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: We're back together again baby.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We're back.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: They tried to keep us apart, but they couldnt. It was like destiny.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I-- I realized that for whatever reason I... just couldn't do better than kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [whispers] Yeah.
